de.uka.ipd.sdq.beagle.core

Class Blackboard

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.uka.ipd.sdq.beagle.core.Blackboard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Blackboard
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Central and only storage of all knowledge gained by Beagle. Implements, together with BeagleController, the Blackboard pattern from POSA I. The Blackboard’s vocabularies are: ResourceDemandingInternalAction, SEFFBranch, SEFFLoop, ResourceDemandMeasurementResult, BranchDecisionMeasurementResult , LoopRepetitionCountMeasurementResult and EvaluableExpression. It further allows classes to store custom data.

    The Blackboard is typically not accessed directly by its using classes, but through blackboard views (recognisable by having the BlackboardView suffix). These are surrogates for the blackboard. They don’t modify its contents but only restrict access to it.

    See Also:
    BeagleController, Serialized Form

        public java.util.Set<SEFFLoop> getAllSEFFLoops()
        All SEFF loops known to Beagle.
        Returns:
        all SEFF loops known to Beagle. Changes to the returned set will not modify the blackboard content. Is never null.

      • writeFor

        public <WRITTEN_TYPE extends java.io.Serializable> void writeFor(java.lang.Class<? extends BlackboardStorer<WRITTEN_TYPE>> writer,
                                                                 WRITTEN_TYPE written)
        Writes data for writer to the blackboard. This method serves as a type safe mean for tools to store data that is not part of their results. Values stored here will never contribute to Beagle’s results. Any class calling this method should always pass its own Class instance as writer. writer has to implement BlackboardStorer and thereby declare the type of values they write. Calling this method will override any data potentially stored previously for the given writer.
        Type Parameters:
        WRITTEN_TYPE - written’s type.
        Parameters:
        writer - The class the data should be written for. Must not be null.
        written - The data to write.

      • readFor

        public <WRITTEN_TYPE extends java.io.Serializable> WRITTEN_TYPE readFor(java.lang.Class<? extends BlackboardStorer<WRITTEN_TYPE>> writer)
        Reads data previously written for writer through writeFor(Class, Serializable).
        Type Parameters:
        WRITTEN_TYPE - The type of the data to be read.
        Parameters:
        writer - The class the desired data was written for. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        The data written in the last call to writeFor(java.lang.Class<? extends de.uka.ipd.sdq.beagle.core.BlackboardStorer<WRITTEN_TYPE>>, WRITTEN_TYPE) for writer. null if no data has been written for writer yet.
        See Also:
        writeFor(Class, Serializable)

      • getMeasurementResultsFor

        public java.util.Set<ResourceDemandMeasurementResult> getMeasurementResultsFor(SEFFLoop loop)
        Gets all results yet measured for the loop repetitions of loop.
        Parameters:
        loop - A SEFF Loop to get the measurement results of. Must not be null .
        Returns:
        All measurement results reported for loop. Changes to the returned set will not modify the blackboard content. Is never null.

        Parameters:

      • setFinalExpressionFor

        public void setFinalExpressionFor(ResourceDemandingInternalAction rdia,
                                  EvaluableExpression expression)
        Sets expression as the final description of rdia’s measurement results’ parametric dependencies. Consecutive calls to this method will override previous settings.
        Parameters:
        rdia - A resource demanding internal action. Must not be null.
        expression - An evaluable expression describing rdia’s measurement results. May be null to describe that no suitable expression was found.

      • setFinalExpressionFor

        public void setFinalExpressionFor(SEFFLoop loop,
